intro: Ageratum nelsonii, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Ageratum nelsonii is often used as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and ability to attract pollinators.
